meanings.definition: To free or clear from a charge or accusation.
meanings.sent1: The jury decided to acquit the defendant of all charges.
meanings.sent2: The judge will acquit the suspect if there is not enough evidence.
meanings.sent3: It was a relief for the innocent man to be acquitted of the crime.
meanings.sent4: Her impeccable alibi helped acquit her from any suspicion.
meanings.sent5: The evidence presented in court clearly showed the need to acquit the accused.

meanings.definition: To conduct oneself or perform in a specified way.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to acquit herself with grace in difficult situations.
meanings.sent2: He needs to acquit himself well during the job interview.
meanings.sent3: Despite the mishap, he managed to acquit himself admirably.
meanings.sent4: The team captain must acquit himself as a leader on and off the field.
meanings.sent5: In order to succeed, she must acquit herself professionally at all times.

meanings.definition: To discharge or settle a debt or obligation.
meanings.sent1: He will acquit the loan by the end of the month.
meanings.sent2: The company needs to acquit its financial obligations to avoid bankruptcy.
meanings.sent3: She promised to acquit the debt as soon as she received her paycheck.
meanings.sent4: The customer will acquit the outstanding balance before the due date.
meanings.sent5: It is essential to acquit all dues on time to maintain a good credit score.
